meanings.definition: To remove calcium deposits from something.
meanings.sent1: I need to decalcify the showerhead to make it work better.
meanings.sent2: The dentist recommended a special toothpaste to decalcify my teeth.
meanings.sent3: Trying to decalcify a rock would be like trying to melt ice with a hairdryer.
meanings.sent4: Her warm smile seemed to decalcify the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The vinegar solution was so effective, it could decalcify even the toughest stains.

meanings.definition: To make something less hard by removing calcium.
meanings.sent1: The nutritionist suggested a diet that would help decalcify my arteries.
meanings.sent2: Using a water softener can decalcify the pipes in your home.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his dance moves could decalcify even the stiffest joints.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to decalcify the rigid lines on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain had a magical ability to decalcify the hardened ground.
